key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs miss 52% of website itineraries yet hold 47% price parity, implying availability—not pricing—is the principal leakage driver.
Mirror-image 51% coverage gap, but Non-US origins see 7.5% higher fares, signalling a perception threat in international markets.
Half of fares are absent and 41% price higher on >21-day searches, jeopardising long-haul corporate and early-booking revenue.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Availability gap unchanged week-over-week; half of shoppers never see UA content on OTAs.
47% of displayed itineraries match website pricing; only 1.8% higher and 0.1% lower with <0.2% deltas.
Non-US origins post 7.1% higher fare rate and long-haul 2.3%, pinpointing surveillance priorities.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Material yet stable − chief limiter on OTA revenue conversion.
High parity signals consistent revenue-management execution.
Markup a negligible 0.14%; minimal risk of price perception damage.
Discounting virtually absent, protecting direct channel yields.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 59% missing; higher-fare rate climbs to 2.3% with 0.21% premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 51% missing, only 1.0% higher-priced—domestic control is strong.
Higher-fare incidence spikes to 7.1%; 54% coverage gap compounds risk abroad.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 1.9% higher-fare share with 0.15% markup; coverage gap 51.5%.
Premium share eases to 1.5% and markup to 0.11%, reflecting tighter advance-purchase management.

mse_highlights.line_content: Minimal WoW improvement; mirrors OTA blind spot.
47.6% of fares match the website, stable over time.
Non-US origins see 18× higher-fare incidence vs. US, eroding global competitiveness.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Visibility, not price, remains the primary issue.
Comparable to OTAs; indicates disciplined distribution.
Average 0.14% premium; slight upward drift warrants monitoring.
Undercutting negligible; revenue dilution risk low.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 58% missing, 42% parity, <0.5% higher—visibility overrides price concerns.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 53% missing, 7.5% higher-priced; 0.11% average premium stresses overseas sales.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Coverage dips to 51.9%, higher-fare 1.4%—advance demand exposure.

gds_highlights.line_content: 51% of itineraries lack a matching GDS fare, unchanged six weeks.
Avg premium +0.29%; true undercuts <0.1%, confirming parity issues stem from availability.
41% higher-priced on >21-day searches with +0.37% uplift—key corporate segment at risk.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Structural availability gap; no progress in six weeks.
Much lower than OTA/MSE, reflecting GDS filing gaps.
Margins modest (+0.29%), but frequency high—hurts fare competitiveness.
Rare undercuts; limited upside for buyers.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 58% missing on long-haul; pricing less of an issue than absence.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 32% parity, 15% higher (+0.12%), 53% absent—better price discipline but still poor coverage.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 41% higher (+0.37%), 52% absent—greatest exposure to revenue leakage.
